title: What is the best form of government or no-government?

body: AnCap - but it's 500 years away from happening. As lib and and right as possible while the state is decoupled from religion, economics and education.
body_html: AnCap - but it's 500 years away from happening. As lib and and right as possible while the state is decoupled from religion, economics and education.

post.title: What is the best form of government or no-government?

body:
Monarchy. 

Because it's the only form of government that can make a country an actual country. That is a place of people connected by a shared ideal embodied by the monarch who is the personification of the nations culture, history, tradition and sense of identity.

Democracies are just the tyranny of the flippant whims of the popular feeling.

Libertarian governments don't form countries, they form social Darwinist societies built on selfishness and individualism. That's why no libertarian government has ever existed and if you did try to set one up it would quickly collapse.
body_html:
Monarchy.

Because it's the only form of government that can make a country an actual country. That is a place of people connected by a shared ideal embodied by the monarch who is the personification of the nations culture, history, tradition and sense of identity.

Democracies are just the tyranny of the flippant whims of the popular feeling.

Libertarian governments don't form countries, they form social Darwinist societies built on selfishness and individualism. That's why no libertarian government has ever existed and if you did try to set one up it would quickly collapse.

post.body_html: I'll go first: as little government and as deep into libright as possible. What do you think?
post.title: What is the best form of government or no-government?

body:
I was thinking about a government system where the ones who hold the highest power also live with the same means as the poorest people. You're the big dog? Well you have to live on the street and work your way up to living inside. It's just a silly idea, with a lot of holes, but the base idea isn't too bad imho.  
  
I feel this would help ground decision makers into actually caring more about the people they're making decisions about.
body_html:
I was thinking about a government system where the ones who hold the highest power also live with the same means as the poorest people. You're the big dog? Well you have to live on the street and work your way up to living inside. It's just a silly idea, with a lot of holes, but the base idea isn't too bad imho.

I feel this would help ground decision makers into actually caring more about the people they're making decisions about.

post.body: I'll go first: as little government and as deep into libright as possible. What do you think?
post.body_html: I'll go first: as little government and as deep into libright as possible. What do you think?
post.title: What is the best form of government or no-government?

body:
This answer has a lot of merit and anyone who knows anything about history knows that a strong monarchy brings immense progress and innovation. A weak monarch is disastrous which is why it doesn't work pragmatically.

I think the biggest advantage of a monarchy is it creates collectivism. The west is collapsing because we have become too individualistic. Fuck we can't even wear a stupid mask for 10 minutes for the sake of other people because it interferes with our right and freedoms. If we can create a democracy where national pride creates collectivism, I think it would work. We need people to stop being lazy because they know there's a safety net. Instead they need to work hard because they want to improve the nation and not drag others down.
body_html:
This answer has a lot of merit and anyone who knows anything about history knows that a strong monarchy brings immense progress and innovation. A weak monarch is disastrous which is why it doesn't work pragmatically.

I think the biggest advantage of a monarchy is it creates collectivism. The west is collapsing because we have become too individualistic. Fuck we can't even wear a stupid mask for 10 minutes for the sake of other people because it interferes with our right and freedoms. If we can create a democracy where national pride creates collectivism, I think it would work. We need people to stop being lazy because they know there's a safety net. Instead they need to work hard because they want to improve the nation and not drag others down.

body:
Collectivism is a poor concept though. A group is the sum of its individuals, there is no "collective consciousness" or spirit or whatnot, it's imaginary. So taking away rights from people to give to "society" isn't going to help anything and is basically the same idea as communism.

I do agree with getting rid of safety nets however, as they encourage laziness.

I do agree with getting rid of safety nets however, as they encourage laziness.

author.bio: A fresh, juicy Canadian orange who is secretly a human.

body:
Theoretically, a good dictatorship is the best government because a dictator can act very quickly.

However, finding and replacing good dictators is very hard.

Theoretically, a good dictatorship is the best government because a dictator can act very quickly.

post.body: I'll go first: as little government and as deep into libright as possible. What do you think?
post.body_html: I'll go first: as little government and as deep into libright as possible. What do you think?
post.title: What is the best form of government or no-government?

body:
The problem with communism and even socialism is if everyone shares everything then the lazy people will take advantage of it. The solution is to have a version of capitalism where people are technically free and there is some inequality but culturally they care enough for one another and for the progress of their nation to share with one another. Before industrialization, this happened under the rule of some monarchs.

I don't this can work with multiculturalism. If someone can just leave their country for a better life somewhere else then why make your country better? You also can't share a culture and sense of pride with people who know nothing about your country and aren't attached to it's history.
body_html:
The problem with communism and even socialism is if everyone shares everything then the lazy people will take advantage of it. The solution is to have a version of capitalism where people are technically free and there is some inequality but culturally they care enough for one another and for the progress of their nation to share with one another. Before industrialization, this happened under the rule of some monarchs.

I don't this can work with multiculturalism. If someone can just leave their country for a better life somewhere else then why make your country better? You also can't share a culture and sense of pride with people who know nothing about your country and aren't attached to it's history.

parent.body:
Collectivism is a poor concept though. A group is the sum of its individuals, there is no "collective consciousness" or spirit or whatnot, it's imaginary. So taking away rights from people to give to "society" isn't going to help anything and is basically the same idea as communism.

I do agree with getting rid of safety nets however, as they encourage laziness.

Collectivism is a poor concept though. A group is the sum of its individuals, there is no "collective consciousness" or spirit or whatnot, it's imaginary. So taking away rights from people to give to "society" isn't going to help anything and is basically the same idea as communism.

I do agree with getting rid of safety nets however, as they encourage laziness.

body: America was very patriotic until recently when one of the two major parties decided to cater to China. And if someone wants to leave your country because there's a better one, that just proves that yours is not the best and just wants to control as many people as possible. You're also arguing for the same kind of hive mind cult-like mentality that AHS and other such groups promote.

And if someone wants to leave your country because there's a better one, that just proves that yours is not the best and just wants to control as many people as possible. parent.body:
The problem with communism and even socialism is if everyone shares everything then the lazy people will take advantage of it. The solution is to have a version of capitalism where people are technically free and there is some inequality but culturally they care enough for one another and for the progress of their nation to share with one another. Before industrialization, this happened under the rule of some monarchs.

I don't this can work with multiculturalism. If someone can just leave their country for a better life somewhere else then why make your country better? You also can't share a culture and sense of pride with people who know nothing about your country and aren't attached to it's history.
parent.body_html:
The problem with communism and even socialism is if everyone shares everything then the lazy people will take advantage of it. The solution is to have a version of capitalism where people are technically free and there is some inequality but culturally they care enough for one another and for the progress of their nation to share with one another. Before industrialization, this happened under the rule of some monarchs.

I don't this can work with multiculturalism. If someone can just leave their country for a better life somewhere else then why make your country better? You also can't share a culture and sense of pride with people who know nothing about your country and aren't attached to it's history.

parent.body:
Theoretically, a good dictatorship is the best government because a dictator can act very quickly.

However, finding and replacing good dictators is very hard.
